com.adeptions.clarguments.converters

Class MultiValueBooleanConverter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.adeptions.clarguments.converters.MultiValueBooleanConverter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ArgumentValueConverter<java.lang.Boolean>

    public class MultiValueBooleanConverter
extends java.lang.Object
implements ArgumentValueConverter<java.lang.Boolean>
    Utility value converter for converting raw values to boolean The various true/false accepted values are specified in constructor

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MultiValueBooleanConverter()
      Constructs an MultiValueBooleanConverter with default values and acceptable raw values All boolean values are accepted - i.e.
      MultiValueBooleanConverter(boolean allowNulls, java.lang.Boolean assumeNullValue, java.lang.String... trueFalsePairs)
      Constructs an MultiValueBooleanConverter with specified acceptable raw values
      MultiValueBooleanConverter(java.lang.String... trueFalsePairs)
      Constructs an MultiValueBooleanConverter with specified acceptable raw values

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.Boolean convert(int tokenPosition, java.lang.String rawValue, Argument argument, ArgumentName specifiedArgumentName)
      Convert the raw incoming arg value string to the appropriate type

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • MultiValueBooleanConverter

        public MultiValueBooleanConverter()
        Constructs an MultiValueBooleanConverter with default values and acceptable raw values All boolean values are accepted - i.e. "true"|"false", "yes"|"no", "on"|"off" and "1"|"0"

      • MultiValueBooleanConverter

        public MultiValueBooleanConverter(java.lang.String... trueFalsePairs)
        Constructs an MultiValueBooleanConverter with specified acceptable raw values
        Parameters:
        trueFalsePairs - the strings that define the acceptable true|false values in the format "true|false" (the vertical bar is required and must have a string either side) All boolean values are accepted - i.e. "true"|"false", "yes"|"no", "on"|"off" and "1"|"0"

      • MultiValueBooleanConverter

        public MultiValueBooleanConverter(boolean allowNulls,
                                  java.lang.Boolean assumeNullValue,
                                  java.lang.String... trueFalsePairs)
        Constructs an MultiValueBooleanConverter with specified acceptable raw values
        Parameters:
        allowNulls - whether nulls should be allowed
        assumeNullValue - when the raw value is null (and nulls are allowed), the value to be assumed
        trueFalsePairs - the strings that define the acceptable true|false values in the format "true|false" (the vertical bar is required and must have a string either side) All boolean values are accepted - i.e. "true"|"false", "yes"|"no", "on"|"off" and "1"|"0"

    • Method Detail

      • convert

        public java.lang.Boolean convert(int tokenPosition,
                                 java.lang.String rawValue,
                                 Argument argument,
                                 ArgumentName specifiedArgumentName)
                          throws BadArgumentException
        Convert the raw incoming arg value string to the appropriate type
        Specified by:
        convert in interface ArgumentValueConverter<java.lang.Boolean>
        Parameters:
        tokenPosition - the position of the token (in original args[])
        rawValue - the raw string arg value
        argument - the argument for which the value was found
        specifiedArgumentName - the name by which the argument was specified
        Returns:
        the converted value
        Throws:
        BadArgumentException - if the conversion fails
